reviews.review:
[h1]Premessa[/h1]
Nel 1998, anno in cui sono stati tanti i capolavori sfornati dall‚Äôindustria, uno in particolare si √® distinto per il modo in cui ha cambiato la concezione di fps. Half-Life ha fatto scuola su diversi aspetti, definendo un era ed affermandosi come gemma dell‚Äôindustria. Sviluppato da Valve e pubblicato da Sierra Entertainment, il primo capitolo della serie definisce le ormai moderne regole per l‚Äôimmersione narrativa.
[h1]Storia[/h1]
Impersoneremo Gordon Freeman, fisico teorico ai laboratori di Black Mesa, complesso situato tra le montagne del deserto del New Mexico dove vengono eseguiti vari esperimenti scientifici di una certa segretezza. Durante un esperimento qualcosa va storto e viene generato uno squarcio dimensionale su di un altro mondo, Xen, permettendo alle creature aliene che lo popolano, di oltrepassarlo ed invadere la struttura. Lo scopo iniziale del giocatore sar√† quindi quello di sopravvivere e farsi strada verso la superficie per essere salvato dalle squadre di soccorso. Per quanto possa sembrare banale questo incipit dalla forte influenza fantascientifica degli anni 90‚Äô, la sottotrama, gli eventi, le rivelazioni e scoperte che si susseguono esplorando i laboratori di Black Mesa nonch√© il modo in cui vengono raccontati, inedito al tempo, sdoganano qualsiasi clich√® e costruiscono una trama dalla s√¨ impronta fantascientifica, ma fortemente contaminata dai generi Horror-Thriller. Non ci sono intermezzi video o cut-scene, il giocatore ha (quasi) sempre il controllo del personaggio e gli eventi vengono narrati attraverso eventi scriptati durante tutto il gioco. Incredibile per l‚Äôepoca, anche l‚Äô immersivit√† data dagli npc che interagiscono con l‚Äôambiente, tra di loro e con il giocatore, rendendo per la prima volta in un fps il mondo vivo. Questi, seppur mere comparse senza sviluppo di background, contribuiscono a rendere partecipe il giocatore negli eventi e lo aiutano anche in alcuni frangenti. I personaggi principali sono in realt√† solo due, di cui uno √® il protagonista, ma tanto basta a rendere la trama profonda e stimolante in quanto estremamente immersiva grazie agli eventi scriptati, le comparse che popolano i laboratori e i primi esempi di narrativa cinematografica. In un panorama videoludico dove il giocatore era sempre al centro degli eventi e la sorgente scatenante, qui il giocatore si trova a far parte di una narrazione che non pu√≤ controllare, dove √® la trama la protagonista vera.
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Half life si presenta come un fps classico, dove non c‚Äô√® possibilit√† di mirare ed i movimenti sono estremamente veloci ed ampi. Quest‚Äôultimo si rivela, in un gioco che abbandona i canoni di Quake o Doom di velocit√† e caos in favore di trama e immersivit√†, un difetto fastidioso in alcuni frangenti dove √® necessaria una certa precisione di movimento. La componente shooter √® in linea con la qualit√† degli anni 90, con un buon arsenale ed un discreto numero di nemici tra umani, alieni e sistemi di difesa. Interessanti i puzzle ambientali, che non richiedono profonde riflessioni per essere superati, ma contribuiscono all‚Äôimmersione dell‚Äôambiente estremamente interattivo. Sar√† possibile interagire con gli npc che popolano i laboratori per aiutarci a superare alcune porte o affrontare degli alieni. L‚Äôambiente √® ricco di elementi, la maggior parte interagibili fisicamente e parte integrante, spesso, dei puzzle ambientali e di alcune sezioni definibili ‚Äúplatform‚Äù. L‚Äôinterfaccia spartana, costituita semplicemente dalla salute, armatura e colpi per l‚Äôarma, pecca nell‚Äôidentificazione e precisione dei danni subiti. Lungo tutto il corso del gioco troveremo sezioni di gameplay sempre diversificate e ben amalgamate tra storia, shooting, platform e enigmi ambientali, in una altrettanta diversificazione dei luoghi e ambienti.
[h1]Comparto Tecnico[/h1]
Il motore di gioco √® una versione modificata del Quake Engine. Graficamente non brilla come altre produzioni del periodo, con un sistema di illuminazione abbastanza approssimativo e una diversit√† poligonale e texture per gli npc ripetitiva. Rimane per√≤ in linea con la qualit√† generale dettata dall epoca. A stupire del comparto tecnico sono le IA degli npc e la massiccia presenza di eventi scriptati. Gli npc reagiscono alle azioni del giocatore e l‚Äôia nemica prende copertura e si sposta per mettersi al riparo o ottenere una migliore posizione. La colonna sonora non √® particolarmente incisiva, sia per la qualit√† in s√© sia perch√©, per la maggior parte del tempo, a farla da padrone saranno il silenzio ed i rumori ambientali nelle varie sezioni di gioco, che amplificano la sensazione di thriller/horror che il titolo vuole assumere. Su di un silenzioso sottofondo udiremo rumore di passi, versi, perdite di tubature, vetri rotti, urla e suoni di ogni tipo. Il doppiaggio italiano, considerando anche lo standard dei tempi, √® piuttosto buono.
[h1]Conclusione[/h1]
Se oggi in un fps non ci stupiamo di narrazioni profonde e cinematografiche, di ambienti interattivi, di npc che popolano il mondo di gioco e lo rendono vivo, di eventi scriptati, se non ci stupiamo di maggiore diversit√† nel gameplay, lo si deve ad Half Life. Uno dei primi casi di vera e propria regia in mano al giocatore, inserito in un mondo vivo, dove non √® pi√π al centro degli eventi ma parte integrante di essi. Un esempio puro di fps al servizio della narrazione con tanto di diversificazione nel gameplay che non si limita solo al puntare e sparare, canone degli fps anni 90‚Äô. Il comparto tecnico non rivoluzionario ed anzi con alcuni difetti, non scalfisce di molto la nomea che questo titolo ha guadagnato meritatamente.
[h1]Voto[/h1]
[b]93/100[/b]

If you haven't played the Half-Life serious you're missing out. With inventive combat, levels and story. This entire series is gold. What more needs to be said?

So here we are, where it all started for Valve, the original Half-Life, is it as amazing as everyone claims? Let‚Äôs find out.

Pros:

1. Good Graphics for a 1998 release, the visual style is very nice and charming to look at even today, character models also look good for the time as do weapons, and visual effects.

2. A very well built atmosphere with the survival horror aspect and each environment really adds to the atmosphere as a whole. You‚Äôll explore many labs, production factories, and even go outside the complex, and with the well built atmosphere in each area, you really feel like you‚Äôre there.

3. The Story at first is intriguing as you are left wondering what is happening and want to know more and this only continues as it builds up towards the end.

4. This game does something rather revolutionary for the FPS genre with the way it tells its story as during "cutscenes" if you will, you have the ability to move freely in the world while everything happens, meaning that gameplay isn't broken up during story moments, while this was technically already seen before in GoldenEye 007 for Nintendo 64, Half-Life does it better as you're given more freedom in the environment then GoldenEye and Half-Life is fully voiced acted as opposed to being subtitles only as seen in GE. Really nice innovation that Half-Life brought to the table here.


5. The gameplay has a good balance between your typical action that you‚Äôd expect and solving puzzles to proceed. Puzzles are well varied and take some thinking to solve, it‚Äôs a nice break from the action.

6. The weapons in this game are really awesome, from the 9MM Glock to the SMG, to the Shotgun, Magnum and the Crossbow and explosives. You have a pretty healthy arsenal of weapons here and each weapon feels unique and like they serve their own purposes with strengths and weaknesses. The sounds they make feel great and they're fun to use. My favorites have to be the Shotgun, SMG and Magnum, those 3 seriously pack a punch. Not once in this game do you feel like your weapon selection is lacking.

7. The enemy types you encounter are vast and quite varied. You‚Äôll fight Headcrabs, Zombies, Marines, Assassins, Bullsquids, Barnacles and more. Each enemy feels distinct in how they combat you and one must plan out different ways to deal with each one effectively, having multiple enemy types is always a good thing, especially when they‚Äôre done well like they are here.

8. The G-Man, I don't think anything else needs to be said about why this is a pro

9. Despite each character really only having 2 or 3 voice actors, the voices are charming if a bit cheesy at times.

10. The difficulties are very well balanced. The higher you go the more damage you take obviously and enemies take a bit more, and health pickups give you less health overall, but you never feel like it‚Äôs unfair. Half-Life on hard is a well designed challenge which is great as some shooters like to artificially increase difficulty.

11. While there isn‚Äôt much of it, the music in this game when it is present is quite good. It ranges from atmospheric ambience to heavy hard hitting rock that pumps you up for a big fight.

12. very good as the game is more focused on survival horror as you make your way through the Black Mesa Laboratory while aliens and various other creepy creatures invade the place, armed with only a limited amount of supplies and a crowbar, you have to really preserve your ammo to survive. I love the first hour or 2 of this game and I wish the rest of the game retained that horror feel.


Cons:


1. A few of the chapters in the game suffer from feeling either rushed or just being too long. The biggest offender and probably best example of this goes to On A Rail, it speaks volumes that nobody really likes this chapter as it's incredibly tedious and drags on. The chapter mainly boils down to using a monorail, having to stop a few moments later to either remove an obstacle or take out enemies and then repeating the process around 4 times or so, it gets old quick.


3. Some enemies in the game can feel a bit too bullet spongey which at times can make the game feel a bit unfair. The biggest offender of this is probably the Ichthyosaur as they take so much damage to kill and since they‚Äôre only really found underwater, this means the only 2 weapons that are really viable against them are the 9MM and the Crossbow as those are the only 2 that enable you to shoot underwater. Most enemies, even some that take more abuse than others, often only take more because they tend to actively avoid your gunfire such as the Marines, focused fire on them is enough to deal with them. But the Ichthyosaur doesn‚Äôt do this,


4. On the topic of enemies, one issue with this game is the hitscan problem. For those unaware: hitscan is a feature in games that essentially means if enemies have a line of sight on you, they will hit you, meaning they aren‚Äôt projectile based. Now of course this is common place in many shooters, especially back in those days, but in Half-Life at times it feels like you‚Äôre getting sniped and because of the hitscan, enemies can feel tougher than they should and often you can be punished for someone you cannot see. Just minor things like that can be a tad frustrating,
                                                                
4. Some sections in the game are a bit poorly designed to put it blunt, obviously this is more forgivable as it was Valve‚Äôs first game but it‚Äôs worth bringing up as a flaw. Some examples of this include sections where it is impossible to avoid taking damage although this is sorta mitigated by you getting health pickups but it doesn‚Äôt excuse it. Others can be enemies that can easily ambush you and you not being able to do anything about it without knowing beforehand that it‚Äôs going to occur, just things like that.

5. Xen, this whole chapter deserves it's own con because man it's just terrible and even Valve themselves admit to it's shortcomings. The novelty of being in the alien world wears off quite fast and the levels and tasks you have to do are just really boring and feel cobbled together. Top that off with a pretty annoying and tedious Final Boss and it's easy to see why even the most hardcore of fans stop playing when they reach Xen

6. The Decision to make Gordon Freeman be a silent protagonist while acceptable back in 1998, is honestly just plain bad by today's standards. Having him not talk is supposed to make you feel immersed into the levels and atmosphere but if anything I find it takes me out of the experience because you have all these characters talking to you like you're best buds are like you've been there for a while yet Gordon doesn't utter a single word in response, and due to cutscenes always being in first person, you don't even get to see him express emotion.




So with that said that‚Äôs mainly all I have to say about Half-Life. What do I think overall? I think the game is honestly a pretty great time, it has a lot of good things about it, although some things do miss the mark a fair bit, making the game a bit flawed in the grand scheme of things. I think while the game is great, I feel it is a bit overrated as I feel a section of it‚Äôs fans are blinded by all the positives and only sing the praises while ignoring the pretty obvious flaws on display. But hey it‚Äôs still a solid time and I‚Äôll be honest: on my first playthrough I didn‚Äôt enjoy it much but on a 2nd playthrough you do get to appreciate it a lot more. 


So I‚Äôd recommend this game if you are interested, it‚Äôs only 10 dollars normally and goes on sale often for far less than that so really what‚Äôs stopping you from trying it? The only thing I‚Äôll say is don‚Äôt go in expecting this masterpiece and listen to the hype as you may be disappointed like I originally was, but if you go in expecting a fun classic shooter, that‚Äôs exactly what you‚Äôll get. 

If I had to give Half-Life 1 a rating, I would give it a solid 8/10.
very great game. Still holds up even today

Creo que tengo la oportunidad de decir que este juego en mi opini√≥n, Es el mejor juego que puede existir, Es un juego s√≠mplemente hermoso Aunque es un juego de hace mas de 20 a√±os es solo incre√≠ble, Conoci la saga half life en 2010 y no me arrepiento de desperdiciar mis horas en tal obra maestra Eh jugado la saga half life Por tantas horas que me se cada di√°logo de cada personaje de cada juego de esta saga, hace 1 a√±o tube la oportunidad de comprar half life despues de jugarlo pirata por muchos a√±os y valio cada sentabo invertido en esta compra no me arrepiento de nada si est√°s por comprar half life y estas dudando no lo pienses, compralo te divertiras te lo aseguro, Half life es una aventura que no puedes desperdiciar.

There's nothing I can say about this game that hasn't been said already. Half-Life is a classic that holds up remarkably well even today. It does start to wear out its welcome after you get to Xen, but the game overall is a good time and you can buy it for almost nothing on sale, so it's worth checking out if you want to experience a game that was very influential for its time. This was fun to revisit and I look forward to seeing how Black Mesa adapts HL1 for modern audiences.

Vale, ya se sabe que este es un buen juego, pero... ¬øPor qu√©? Mas all√° de su ya muy hablada narrativa (que es fant√°stica por cierto) he de decir que, aunque sea un juego bastante antiguo (de 1998 para ser espec√≠fico), es extremadamente entretenido, tiene una jugabilidad s√∫per divertida, incluso para est√°ndares de hoy en d√≠a, adem√°s de que es bastante m√°s intuitivo que muchos juegos de la √©poca. Su mezcla de acci√≥n, puzzles y parkour lo hacen un juego en el que tienes que estar haciendo algo todo el rato, y no solamente disparar como en muchos FPS de la √©poca. Como ya he dicho antes me parece que la narrativa es fant√°stica, la innovadora manera de hacerte experimentar los hechos en tiempo real y no mediante cinem√°ticas es algo que no vemos mucho, ni en juegos de hoy en d√≠a. Adem√°s me gusta mucho como se nota que ten√≠an ya bien planteado la historia que se iba a desarrollar a lo largo de la saga, ya que se plantean una gran cantidad de cosas que en entregas posteriores de la saga se desarrollan de manera impresionante (no voy a mencionar nada ya que no quiero entrar en spoilers, solo lo dejo caer). La dificultad es bastante asequible y me parece que se ajusta bastante bien en algunos momento para darte un buen desaf√≠o y para simplemente relajarte en otros (todo sea dicho, hay algunos momentos en los que he tenido que pasar muchas pantallas seguidas a 2 o 5 de vida, lo cual obviamente me ha llevado una gran cantidad de intentos y memorizaci√≥n del mapa, todo esto a dificultad intermedia). La banda sonora tampoco es nada del otro mundo pero encaja bastante bien en los momentos en los que suena, aunque bueno, eso tampoco es un punto muy importante en videojuegos de este estilo, solo era por mencionarlo. En conclusi√≥n, esto es una obra maestra, una joya de los videojuegos que merece ser probada y analizada para que puedas llegar a tu propia conclusi√≥n, yo solo lo recomiendo pero obviamente la √∫ltima decisi√≥n de probarlo es solamente tuya, por cierto, esto es una referencia al juego as√≠ que ; )
